alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 30 at 9:59AM MDT until July 30 at 3:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. Torrential rainfall rates near 2 inches in one hour are likely with the stronger storms. * WHERE...A portion of central New Mexico, including the following area, Middle Rio Grande Valley including the Albuquerque Metro Area. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of arroyos, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone as well as urban and poor drainage locations. Torrential rainfall will result in hazardous travel conditions with near-zero visibility at times and significant ponding of water on roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Urban drainages and areas that have received recent heavy rainfall will be especially susceptible to dangerous flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area
